longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports must be valid for at least 6 months from date of
  arrival. 

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Burkina Faso can obtain
a single entry visa on arrival, for a max. stay of 30 days,
provided passport contains 1 unused visa page. Fee: USD 30.-
(payable in USD only).
Visa required, except for Nationals of Burkina Faso can obtain
a multiple entry visa on arrival, for a max. stay between 30
and 90 days, provided:  
Additional Information:
- Nationals of Burkina Faso may extend their stay to a total
  cumulative stay of 90 days by submitting their application
  to the Immigration Department. Fee: USD 35.- for up to 30
  days; USD 75.- for between 30 and 60 days. 
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay (USD 150.- per day), proof of hotel
  accommodations arrangements and documents required for their
  next destination.
- Those who have overstayed their visa may be subject to
  fines.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country.
  Recommended prevention: C.
